tool.name: bwa-mem
tool.command:
## Build BWA genome index bash ${__tool_directory__}/02_bwa.sh '$genomeSequence'; mkdir -p ${__tool_directory__}/$$ && /home/galaxy/miniconda3/envs/bio/bin/samtools faidx ${genomeSequence} ; cut -f 1-2 ${genomeSequence}.fai > ${genomeSequence}.genome ;
## BWA alignment /home/galaxy/miniconda3/envs/bio/bin/bwa mem -t $thread #if $algorithm_options.algorithm_options_selector == "advanced": -k $algorithm_options.minimum_seed_length -w $algorithm_options.band_width -d $algorithm_options.off_diagonal_X_dropoff -r $algorithm_options.internal_seeds -y $algorithm_options.seed_occurrence -c $algorithm_options.skip_seeds -D $algorithm_options.drop_chains -W $algorithm_options.discard_a_chain -m $algorithm_options.rounds $algorithm_options.S $algorithm_options.P #end if '$genomeSequence' #if $fqType.single_or_paired == "single": $fqType.readSE > ${__tool_directory__}/$$/tmp.sam; /home/galaxy/miniconda3/envs/bio/bin/samtools view -@ $thread -F 4 -Sb ${__tool_directory__}/$$/tmp.sam | /home/galaxy/miniconda3/envs/bio/bin/samtools sort -@ $thread -o $output - && /home/galaxy/miniconda3/envs/bio/bin/samtools index $output && /home/galaxy/miniconda3/envs/bio/bin/bedtools genomecov -dz -ibam $output -g ${genomeSequence}.genome > $alignmentReadsCoverage #elif $fqType.single_or_paired == "paired": $fqType.readR1 $fqType.readR2 > ${__tool_directory__}/$$/tmp.sam; /home/galaxy/miniconda3/envs/bio/bin/samtools view -@ 10 -F 4 -Sb ${__tool_directory__}/$$/tmp.sam | /home/galaxy/miniconda3/envs/bio/bin/samtools sort -@ 10 -o ${__tool_directory__}/$$/tmp.bam - && /home/galaxy/miniconda3/envs/bio/bin/samtools index ${__tool_directory__}/$$/tmp.bam && /home/galaxy/miniconda3/envs/bio/bin/samtools view -bS -@ 10 -h -f 3 -F 12 -o $output_PE ${__tool_directory__}/$$/tmp.bam && /home/galaxy/miniconda3/envs/bio/bin/samtools index $output_PE && /home/galaxy/miniconda3/envs/bio/bin/bedtools genomecov -dz -pc -ibam $output_PE -g ${genomeSequence}.genome > $alignmentReadsCoverage_PE #end if

param.name: internal_seeds
param.label: look for internal seeds inside a seed longer than {-k} * FLOAT

param.name: seed_occurrence
param.label: seed occurrence for the 3rd round seeding

param.name: skip_seeds
param.label: Skip seeds with more than INT occurrences

param.name: drop_chains
param.label: Drop chains shorter than FLOAT fraction of the longest overlapping chain

param.name: discard_a_chain
param.label: Discard a chain if seeded bases shorter than INT

param.name: rounds
param.label: Perform at most INT rounds of mate rescues for each read
Skip pairing
param.help: Mate rescue performed unless -S also in use

exit_code.description: Error Running combine collection to a file

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
BWA-MEM is an alignment algorithm for aligning sequence reads or long query sequences against a large reference genome such as human. It automatically chooses between local and end-to-end alignments, supports paired-end reads and performs chimeric alignment. The algorithm is robust to sequencing errors and applicable to a wide range of sequence lengths from 70bp to a few megabases.
.. class:: infomark
**Inputs**
- **Epitranscriptome sequencing reads in FASTQ format** - **Reference genome in FASTA format**
.. class:: infomark
**Outputs**
- Alignments in BAM format - ReadsCoverage summary in TXT format generate by BEDtools
